file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 34-21-03-07 - AHRS FAN - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL AHRS FAN - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the fan filter of the Attitude and Heading Reference Computer (AHC). B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 34-21-03-100-801-A ♦ AHRS FAN FILTER - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 34-21-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 34-21-03-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AHRS FAN FILTER - CLEANING A. General (1) The AHC filters are installed on the side of the AHC mounting tray, on the electronic compartment. To get access to the filters, it is necessary to open access panel 113CZ (AMM MPP 06-00-00/100). (2) To do the task, make sure that the ground safety pin is installed on the nose landing gear (AMM 32-00-01/1). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM 32-00-01/1 - AMM MPP 06-00-00/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113CZ Electronic Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Platform To help the access to the fan filter 1 F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C32 (if applicable) Lockwire AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Electronic Compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 34-21-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the AHRS 1 and AHRS 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE GROUND SAFETY PIN IS INSTALLED ON THE NOSE LANDING GEAR (AMM 32-00-01/1). (2) Open access panel 113CZ to get access to the AHC. (3) Get access to the fan filter installed on the side of the AHC mounting tray. J. Clean AHRS Fan Filter (Figure 701) SUBTASK 140-002-A (1) If applicable, loosen or cut the lockwire that lock the cover of the fan filter. (2) Hold and click out the cover of the fan filter to remove it from fan case. (3) Visually inspect the filter for signs of damage or deterioration. Replace filter if any damage or deterioration is found. (4) Clean the spongy filter with dry compressed air at a pressure not to exceed 30 psi. CAUTION: • TEMPERATURE OF THE DETERGENT SOLUTION OR THE WATER MUST NOT EXCEED 60ÃÂ°C (140ÃÂ°F). • DO NOT USE CHLORINE SOLUTIONS. (5) Wash the filter in a mild detergent solution and rinse with water. (6) Let the filter air dry. (7) Position the cleaned filter in the fan case. (8) Push in the filter to install it in the fan case. (9) If applicable, install the lockwire on the fan filter case and twist it. NOTE: Not all fan assemblies have the lockwire. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close access panel 113CZ. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, close the AHRS 1 and AHRS 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them.
